phrase.cizu_name: in fine feather 或 in good feather  或 in high feather

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fether, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch veer and German Feder, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit patra 'wing', Latin penna 'feather', and Greek pteron, pterux 'wing'

encyclopedia.content: 函数简介 函数功能：绘制羽状图。 语法格式： feather(U,V) 其中U、V表示一组向量，U是向量的横坐标（x分量），V是向量的纵坐标（y分量）。该调用格式将在水平轴上等间隔的把这些向量用带箭头的线绘制出来。具体算法可通过open feather或type feather查看该函数源代码来研究。 feather(Z) 这里Z是一组复数，这种调用格式Z的实部对应向量的x分量，虚部对应向量的y分量。该调用格式相当于feather(real(Z),imag(Z))。 feather(...,Li

entry.def: A bird's feathers are the soft covering on its body. Each feather consists of a lot of smooth hairs on each side of a thin stiff centre.

example.ex: ...a hat that she had made herself from black ostrich feathers.
example.tran: 她用黑色鸵鸟羽毛给自己做的帽子

entry.tran: 同类的人;志趣相投的人;一丘之貉
entry.def: If you describe two people as birds of a feather, you mean that they have very similar characteristics, interests, or beliefs.

example.ex: She and my mother were birds of a feather.
example.tran: 她和我妈妈是一个类型的人。

entry.tran: 可引以为豪的事;荣耀的事;有好处的事
entry.def: If you describe something that someone has achieved as a feather in their cap, you mean that they can be proud of it or that it might bring them some advantage.

example.ex: Harry's appointment to this important post was a feather in his cap.
example.tran: 哈里被任命担任如此要职，这是件荣耀的事。
